pageTitle: Jamis Dakar XCT Comp Mountain Bike 2012 > Sale | Jenson USA
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {1997=Jamis bicycles has a long history of innovating revolutionary bikes. This dates all the way back to 1979 with the introduction of the Earth Cruiser. The Earth Cruiser helped to spark the beach cruiser revolution. This revolution hasn’t stopped with Jamis, merely shifted focus. Today Jamis develops and produces top of the line Road and Mountain bikes. Leveraging their 30+ years of experience, Jamis is able to craft Race driven performance with trickle down for the average rider as well. Jamis has a goal to build the perfect bike, an impossible goal. To Jamis, it’s the only one worth doing.}
textBeforeTable: Jamis Lock-On Grips Grips WTB Volt Race Saddle Saddle Ritchey Comp Seatpost Seatpost Ritchey Comp 4-Axis Stem Stem Ritchey Comp Rizer Bar Bars Avid Elixir 1 hydraulic disc brakes 180mm front & 160mm rear rotors Brakes Geax Gato 2.3” front & AKA 2.2” rear, folding Tires Mavic XM319 disc-specific/eyeletted rims, 32H Formula sealed bearing disc hubs Wheels X.5 GXP Sram Sram X.5 9 speed/td> Shifters Sram X.5 Resr D.Rail Sram X.5 Front D.Rail Rock Shox Monarch R High Volume 10mm hardware Rear Shock RST Titan-15 Air Fork Fork Kinesium Alloy Frame, 130mm Travel MP4 Linkage Design Frame SPECIFICATIONS Claimed Weight: 30.75lbs A good component build is what makes or breaks a bike. The fork outfitted on this XCT Comp is the RST Titan-15 Air. The fork boasts hydraulic lock-out with external rebound damping, tapered alloy steerer, magnesium lower legs, 32mm stanchions, and 140mm of travel. Drivetrain is just as important as anything else, so it makes sense that Jamis has selected Sram drivetrain. A Sram X.5 rear derailleur is matched up with a Sram X.5 front derailleur. Shifters a very vital as well, so it makes sense that Jamis selected the X.5 9 speed trigger shifters. All of these components work in conjunction < /br>
